alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 23 at 11:03AM MST until December 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM MST THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches possible. Northerly winds gusting 40 to 50 mph are expected along with areas of blowing snow and poor visibility. * WHERE...Limon, Southern Lincoln County, and Akron. * WHEN...From 8 PM MST this evening through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility to a quarter mile or less. Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
